oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Phosphonatgehalte in Wein aus ökologischem Weinbau
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kauer, Prof.Dr. Randolf
Schmidt, M.
Berkelmann-Löhnertz, B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: "Organics" in general
Viticulture
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Phosphonates are very effective against downy mildew (plasmopara viticola) in vines. Current test findings indicate that with a restricted use, up to development stage 68 (end of flowering time),the problem of residues can be successfully combated.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kauer, Prof.Dr. Randolf; Schmidt, M. and Berkelmann-Löhnertz, B. (2004) Phosphonatgehalte in Wein aus ökologischem Weinbau. [Phosphonates in wines from organic viticulture.] In: Heß, J and Rahmann, G (Eds.) Ende der Nische, Beiträge zur 8. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, kassel university press GmbH, Kassel.
